intro: Moussonia triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered moussonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It has opposite, simple leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Moussonia triflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
